refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [zp[, dzpdx, dzpdy[, d2zpdxx, d2zpdxy, d2zpdyy]]]=interp2d(xp, yp, x, y, C [,out_mode])

listitem.para: a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the x coordinates of the points where the spline is to be evaluated.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the y coordinates of the points where the spline is to be evaluated.
a 1-by-nx matrix of doubles, the x coordinate of the interpolation points. We must have x(i)<x(i+1), for i=1,2,...,nx-1.
a 1-by-ny matrix of doubles, the y coordinate of the interpolation points. We must have y(i)<y(i+1), for i=1,2,...,ny-1.
The coefficients of the bicubic spline. The input argument of the interp2d function is the output argument of the splin2d function.
a 1-by-1 matrix of strings, the evaluation of s outside the range [x(1),x(nx)] by [y(1),y(ny)].
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the evaluation of the z coordinate of the spline, i.e. zp(i,j)=s(xp(i,j),yp(i,j)), for i=1,2,...,mx and j = 1,2,...,my.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the first derivative of the spline with respect to x.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the first derivative of the spline with respect to y.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the second derivative of the spline with respect to x.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the second derivative of the spline with respect to x and y.
a mx-by-my matrix of doubles, the second derivative of the spline with respect to y.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para:
Given three vectors (x,y,C) defining a bicubic spline or sub-spline function (see splin2d) this function evaluates s (and ds/dx, ds/dy, d2s/dxx, d2s/dxy, d2s/dyy
if needed) at (xp(i),yp(i)) :

The out_mode parameter defines the evaluation rule for extrapolation, i.e. for (xp(i),yp(i)) not in [x(1),x(nx)]x[y(1),y(ny)]
:

listitem.para: an extrapolation by zero is done
the extrapolation is defined as follows :
listitem.programlisting: s(x,y) = s(proj(x,y)) where proj(x,y) is nearest point of [x(1),x(nx)]x[y(1),y(ny)] from (x,y)

listitem.para: the extrapolation is done by using the nearest bicubic-patch from (x,y).
